H0.text: Radiation is the transfer of heat in the atmosphere by winds that circulate between the equator and the poles.

H1.text: Insulation is the transfer of heat in the atmosphere by winds that circulate between the equator and the poles.

H2.text: Convection is the transfer of heat in the atmosphere by winds that circulate between the equator and the poles.

H3.text: Conduction is the transfer of heat in the atmosphere by winds that circulate between the equator and the poles.

A4.text: Atmospheric convection is the vertical transport of heat and moisture in the atmosphere.

A5.text: Thermals are created by the uneven heating of the Earth's surface from solar radiation.

A6.text: Convective heat transfer is the transfer of heat from one place to another by the movement of fluids.

A7.text: Convection is usually the dominant form of heat transfer in liquids and gases.
